originalText.text: Having my mom living at Carnegie East has really made a life saving difference for my family.  The staff are excellent and I know she's safe.  She likes her apartment and her neighbors, has been able to enjoy her freedom, but on more than one occasion the staff contacted me when she needed care and we got her to the hospital.  My mom enjoys herself and I know she's in good hands.

My mom enjoys herself and I know she's in good hands.

originalText.text: My husband spent two years at Carnegie. I visited him regularly and shared many of his activities, movies, concerts, and Friday night services. he was safe and satisfied with his life, although he continue to struggle with balance problems. Carnegie allowed us to spend the last years of our marriage together. Us to be separate

originalText.text: I am eternally grateful to Carnegie East House for caring for my mother. My mothers was cared for by a staff that was sincere, kind, friendly, competent and accommodating in every way. They took a personal interest in making sure she felt welcomed and maintained a personal interest in her comfort and her needs throughout her 5 years there. I am especially grateful to Joseph H. Girven, Executive Director for his leadership in making sure that everyone at Carnegie East felt content and secure. His kindness will always be remembered! Many thanks to you all, for making my mother very happy.

originalText.text:
My Mother has been at Carnegie East House for three years, having moved back to New York City from Florida.  We heard about Carnegie East House from a family friend and looked at several other places first.
I cant say enough about all the kind Staff, fabulous Activities, Food, Rooms with views, and gorgeous patio. The care that my Mother gets living here is excellent.  My Mother, Shirley, is in her 90's and participates in so many things including evening movies and matinees, exercise classes, book club, music appreciation etc. She has met some new friends and is never lonely.
The Activities Director, Scott Gordon is incredible and Joe Girven, who is head of Carnegie East House communicates regularly with families and protected the community from Covid and not one resident got sick!
Located on The Upper Eastside, so much is nearby including the famous 92nd Street YMCA.  Finally, compared to other senior living facilities, the pricing is fair and affordable.
Our family is truly happy that we found Carnegie East House.

Pat Rod Jennings
